questions.question: What happens to the spectrum of a star that is moving away from Earth?
What happens to the spectral lines of a star that is moving toward Earth?

choices.answer: The waves spread out, and the frequency of each line increases.
The waves spread out, and the frequency of each line decreases.
The waves compress, and the frequency of each line increases.
The waves compress, and the frequency of each line decreases.

questions.question: A telescope’s main job is to make objects appear bigger
Tangential motion is the which of the following movements?
Parallax is the shift in the position of an object when viewed from the same location.
Which of the following are the three (3) spectrum?
Scientists determine the composition and temperature of stars _____.

choices.answer: by analyzing the vibrations that stars emit
through samples of matter on the surface of stars
by analyzing the spectra of the light that stars emit

questions.question: What problem is solved by sending telescopes into space?

choices.answer: interference of dry air in detecting electromagnetic radiation
interference of gamma rays in detecting electromagnetic radiation
interference of Earth’s atmosphere in detecting electromagnetic radiation
inability of Earth telescopes to detect invisible electromagnetic radiation

questions.question: Wave frequency is the number of peaks passing a stationary point during a given time
How will the spectra lines recorded on Earth be shifted for a light-emitting object that is not moving

choices.answer: They will not be shifted at all.

questions.question: What has happened to light that has been blueshifted?
If a dense, non-light producing, interstellar gas were to move between a star and Earth, what would happen to spectrum?

choices.answer: The spectra would show greater redshift.
The number of absorption lines would likely decrease.
The spectra would become a continuous spectra.
The number of absorption lines would likely increase.

questions.question: Doppler effect is an observed change in the frequency of a wave when the source or observer is moving.
